text: hello this is chef john from food wishes
calm with kung pao chicken a simple
chicken peanut stir-fry roughly based on
kung pao chicken and I would have called
a kung pao chicken but you know what it
was just annoying my Chinese friends I
get lots of requests for simple stir
fries here we go we're going to take two
chicken breasts boneless skinless and
cut them up into like 1-inch cubes the
size again as always doesn't really
matter as long as you cut them evenly
that way they cook evenly so after these
are cubed up we're going to throw in a
bowl and do a really simple marinade a
little white wine a little soy sauce a
little brown sugar and the white parts
of a green onion don't try to write all
these ingredients down it's all going to
be written for you at the bottom of the
recipe give it a little mix cover and
refrigerate for one hour while that's
marinating we're going to prep our
vegetables I have two zucchini
we're going to top and tail them cut
them in half lengthwise and then we're
going to do this cut them in triangles
just take your knife like you see me
here a little bit of an angle that way
turn it angle that way turn it angle
that way and you get triangles now why
triangles not squares people like pointy
food prove in fact all right I'm gonna
do the same thing with a red pepper cut
in thick strips and give it the old
angle cut back and forth back and forth
till you got little triangles very cool
I'm also going to slice up a jalapeno
with the seeds this is optional but you
should do it anyway
alright so there's our vegetables
prepped that was pretty easy right once
those are done is time to mix the secret
sauce some white vinegar some rice
vinegar soy sauce sambal chili paste
sesame oil black pepper and again all
the agreements are going to be under the
under the video so don't write anything
down so brown sugar some ketchup so it's
really not authentic some white wine
because I didn't have Chinese wine lots
of garlic and give it a mix then in a
separate little bowl or mixing Cup I'm
going to do one tablespoon of cornstarch
with a couple tablespoons of cold water
all right set that aside here we go
heavy-duty skillet preferably nonstick
oil peanut oil high heat alright when
see the oil start to smoke you're ready
throw in the chicken and let it
caramelize for two or three minutes now
because there's a little bit of brown
sugar and wine and soy sauce you're
going to get a beautiful brown color if
your pan is hot enough and if your heat
is high enough if it's not you're just
going to get boiling chicken juice
having said that if you just do get
boiling chicken juice it'll still be
good but try to get that caramelization
that took about two minutes like I said
add in your chunked vegetables continue
to stir and fry for about two more
minutes
all this is on high heat as high as it
will go I'm going to add some chicken
broth which is going to sort of hit that
hot pan and steam those vegetables now
at this point they should almost be
getting tender all right they're still
probably very firm but they're just
starting to think about softening a
little at that point we're going to add
our sauce ingredients all right stir
that in toss it stir it whatever you
want to do you want to flip like I am go
ahead you know big show off or you can
just stir with a spatula but keep it

cook for about two minutes you're done
when the vegetables are tender enough
for your liking the chicken is going to
be done don't worry the chicken is done
those are small pieces those cook in

thinking hey you could use the walk for

all right if you have a wok and you want

either way works great don't worry all
right so once the vegetables are tender
to your liking dump in your cornstarch
and keep it moving
the beauty of cornstarch is it thickens
right away this was like 30 seconds and
you're going to see here check it out
beautiful sauce at this point we're done
turn it off we're going to throw in a

just throw those on and there you go
all right such an easy delicious
